content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the production interface for copper cable assembly:
• Cable input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5)
• Factory burner inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) with a linked inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5)
• Assembling machine at Position(1.5, 19.5)
• Additional components include a burner inserter at Position(1.5, 17.5) and an output chest at Position(1.5, 21.5)

### Belt Depot at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Serves as an isolated depot for belt routing:
• Wooden chest placed at Position(3.5, 15.5)
• Adjacent transport belt segment at Position(4.5, 15.5)
• Depot burner inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) (pickup at 3.5,15.5; drop at 3.5,13.5)

### Extraction System at Position(–3.5, 27.5)
Facilitates extraction and transfer of items from the source:
• Extraction system burner inserter at Position(–3.5, 27.5) with drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)
• Associated wooden chest at Position(–3.5, 26.5)

### Smelting Facility at Position(–3.0, 19.0)
Handles conversion of raw materials:
• Stone furnace at Position(–3.0, 19.0) producing iron-plate
• Stone furnace at Position(–4.0, 21.0) producing copper-plate
• Wooden chest at Position(–4.5, 18.5)
• Wooden chest at Position(–5.5, 21.5)

### Electricity Generator at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
Provides power for the surrounding network:
• Steam engine (generator) at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
• Boiler at Position(–5.5, 24.0)
• Offshore pump at Position(–7.5, 25.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Issues
  – Multiple steps reported an error: “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object…” Ensure that belt connections target an inserter (which feeds the steam engine) rather than the steam engine itself.

• Entity Placement Distance
  – Errors stating that a wooden chest could not be placed due to the target being too far (e.g. at Position(3.5,15.5)) indicate the need to move the player closer before placement.

• Undefined Variable Usage
  – The NameError regarding ‘target_chest’ shows that a variable was used before being defined. Validate variable names and ensure all necessary targets are properly set in the code.

• Inventory Shortage
  – An error noted “No wooden_chest in inventory” suggests checking inventory counts prior to placement or crafting missing items before attempting the build action.
